content.title: Arteriovenous Fistula Creation
content.definition: Surgical creation of arteriovenous fistula for hemodialysis access, the preferred access type for end-stage renal disease patients.

concepts.definition: KDOQI and Fistula First Initiative guidelines promoting AVF as primary dialysis access.

clinical_features.goals: AVF rate >65% for prevalent dialysis patients

concepts.definition: Hierarchy of AVF placement progressing distal to proximal.
Process of fistula development to allow successful cannulation.

clinical_features.maturation_time: 6-8 weeks for radiocephalic, 4-6 weeks for brachiocephalic

clinical_features.timing: Refer when eGFR <30, create when eGFR <15-20
clinical_features.surgical_technique: End-vein to side-artery anastomosis most common

diagnostic_criteria.functional_access: Adequate flow and depth for two-needle cannulation

content.statement: Arteriovenous Fistula Creation is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Procedures Access that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.
